title: Nightly 2018-05-05 had an unexpected panic
body:
I hit the panic while running clippy as follows:
```
cliff@conakry:~/src/hops$ cargo +nightly clippy
    Checking cfg-if v0.1.3
    Checking libc v0.2.40
    Checking nodrop v0.1.12
    Checking scopeguard v0.3.3
    Checking lazy_static v1.0.0
    Checking byteorder v1.2.2
    Checking memoffset v0.2.1
   Compiling unicode-xid v0.1.0
    Checking slab v0.4.0
    Checking futures v0.1.21
thread 'main' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1', /home/cliff/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/clippy_lints-0.0.197/src/utils/higher.rs:76:32
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.27.0-nightly (f9bfe840f 2018-05-05) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
```

The crate under question consists of a single main.rs and a few cargo dependencies, as below:

### Cargo.toml

```toml
[package]
name = "hops"
version = "0.1.0"
authors = ["J. Cliff Dyer <jcd@sdf.org>"]

[dependencies]
bytes = "*"
clap = "*"
rand = "*"
serde = "*"
serde_derive = "*"
serde_json = "*"
tokio = "0.1"
```

### src/main.rs

```rust
extern crate bytes;
extern crate clap;
extern crate rand;
extern crate serde;
#[macro_use] extern crate serde_derive;
extern crate serde_json;
extern crate tokio;

use bytes::BytesMut;
use clap::{Arg, App};
use rand::random;
use tokio::io;
use tokio::net::{TcpListener, UdpSocket, UdpFramed};
use tokio::prelude::*;
use tokio_io::codec::{Encoder, Decoder};
use serde_json::{de, ser};


pub struct Codec;


impl Codec {
    fn new() -> Codec { Codec }
}

impl Encoder for Codec {
    type Item = Ping;
    type Error = io::Error;
    fn encode(&mut self, item: Ping, dst: &mut BytesMut) -> Result<(), io::Error> {
        dst.put(ser::to_string(item)?);
        Ok(())
    }
}

impl Decoder for Codec {
    type Item = Ping;
    type Error = io::Error;
    fn decode(&mut self, src: &mut BytesMut) -> Result<Option<Ping>, io::Error> {
        let len = src.len();
        let ping = de::from_str(&src.split_to(len))?;
        Ok(Some(ping));
    }
}


#[derive(Clone, Copy, Debug, Serialize, Deserialize)]
struct Ping{
    source: u16, 
    hops: u32
} 


fn main() {
    let matches = App::new("test")
        .arg(Arg::with_name("port")
             .short("p")
             .long("port")
             .takes_value(true))
        .arg(Arg::with_name("neighbors")
             .multiple(true))
        .get_matches();
    let port = matches.value_of("port").expect("port").parse::<u16>().unwrap();
    let neighbors = matches.values_of("neighbors").expect("neighbors")
        .map(|x| x.parse::<u16>().unwrap())
        .collect::<Vec<_>>();
    let addr = ([0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1], port).into();

    let (stream, sink) = UdpFramed::new(
        UdpSocket::bind(&addr).unwrap(),
        Codec::new(),
    ).split();
    stream.for_each(|ping, _socket| {
        if ping.source == port {
            println!("Received ping after {} hops", ping.hops)
        } else {
            let dest = random() % neighbors.len();
            let neighbor = neighbors[dest];
            let dgram = sink.send((Ping { src: ping.src, hops: ping.hops + 1 }, neighbor));
            tokio::spawn(dgram);
        }
        Ok(())
    })
    .map_err(|err| {
        // All tasks must have an `Error` type of `()`. This forces error
        // handling and helps avoid silencing failures.
        //
        // In our example, we are only going to log the error to STDOUT.
        println!("accept error = {:?}", err);
    });
    println!("Server running on {:?}", addr);
    println!("Connecting to neighbors at ports: {:?}", neighbors);
    tokio::run(stream);
}
```

### Cargo.lock

